topic.title: Hong Kong protesters stormed legislature
topic.body:
Here's the Wikipedia link:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Hong_Kong_anti-extradition_bill_protests#Storming_of_Legislative_Council_Complex

I'm very upset about what they did. I admit that the rule of the election in Hong Kong is not democratic. But it is still the rule. 
The rule, we call it constitution, which is the protection of individual rights. It can't be perfect.
Freedom is the ultimate goal. Democracy is the way. The constitution is the guarantee of democracy. 
Now, they have stormed the legislature. They abandoned the constitution. Then where to place democracy they pursued? Some of them already have become criminals.
Many of them don't want to be involved in the investigation. They totally screwed up.
If China Mainland has democracy today, people have the real right to protest. What happened in Hong Kong would be 
thousands of times in China Mainland.
Do you know how many people in China? More than a billion. I can't imagine if several billion people don't agree with the result of an election and they are about to storm the Congress. That's horrible.
If there is no respect for the Constitution, democracy would be dangerous.

topic.title: How to enable crypt connetion? I'm using zeronet-py3
topic.body:
When I open http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats/ .
I found my crypt is none.

Sorry, maybe I have made an confused expression. I mean enable transport encryption like tls.

1562744772_1G5aYYLCYtwKYfnnvLUTNVDC5kmy8.body:
> [nexusoneus](#comment_2_163cCAVJzhzn2hYne8LtFjyAfDbRQP1vv2): Tor?

When I use zeronet-py2, the transport was encrypted by tls, may I enable tls for zeronet-py3?

> [robione](#comment_262_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): probably a missing library or plugin in py3 packaging?

RSA ECC SSL CAcert generation failed, CAcert or CAkey files not exist.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_865_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): When i open /Stats i see crypt: tls-rsai am on Windows 10 and Py3 zeronet (v. 0.7.0). @jessicajones: which OS you are on? which linux, version..?

Mac OS
